cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 65 miles NE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to drift slowly north from the Yucatán Channel into the east-central Gulf of Mexico, then turn northeast toward Florida’s Big Bend before crossing inland over the southeastern United States.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast, near or just south of Cedar Key

weather_observation.watch_coast: Pinar del Río and Isle of Youth in western Cuba (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Yucatán Peninsula from Tulum to Río Lagartos, including Cozumel (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Eastern Gulf Coast—including Tampa Bay/Manatee, the Florida Big Bend—and later the southeast U.S. coastline
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm–force winds (35–45 mph with higher gusts) could arrive in the Tampa Bay / Manatee area late Tuesday night into Wednesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Elevated water levels of 2–4 ft above ground are possible along the immediate Tampa Bay shoreline and adjacent coast if the storm deepens while approaching.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain with locally higher totals are possible across west-central Florida, producing flash-flood potential at the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes associated with outer rainbands and scattered lightning could disrupt cargo handling and vessel movements.
